rooms.name: Courthouse Square (1955)
rooms.description: A pristine town square; the courthouse clock proudly ticks above town.

rooms.name: Hill Valley Library (1955)
rooms.description: A tidy library with polished wooden shelves and helpful librarians.

rooms.name: Hill Valley High School (1955)
rooms.description: A newly painted high school bustling with students.

rooms.name: Football Field (1955)
rooms.description: Well-kept grass and wooden bleachers; the scoreboard shows last week's game.

rooms.name: Oak Park Cemetery (1955)
rooms.description: A simpler, well-kept cemetery with fresh flowers in places.

rooms.name: South Avenue (1955)
rooms.description: A peaceful avenue with families walking in the evenings.

rooms.name: Holts Diner (1955)
rooms.description: A gleaming counter diner with a jukebox and chrome stools.

rooms.name: First Street (1955)
rooms.description: New shops with window displays showcasing the latest goods.

rooms.name: Main Street (West) (1955)
rooms.description: A tidy west side of Main Street with freshly painted signs.

rooms.name: Texaco Garage (1955)
rooms.description: A small, efficiently run gas station and service garage.

rooms.name: Bank (1955)
rooms.description: A steady bank with marble steps and a flag in front.

rooms.name: Brown Mansion (1955)
rooms.description: Dr. Emmett Brown's grand home, a place of odd inventions and eccentricities.

rooms.name: Empty Field (Future Lyon Estates Site)
rooms.description: A large open field with a 'Coming Soon' sign for a future subdivision.

rooms.name: River Road (1955)
rooms.description: A country road beside the river; families sometimes picnic near the bank.

rooms.name: Bridge and Mill (1955)
rooms.description: An old mill and stone bridge; the structure creaks on windy days.

rooms.name: Farmland (1955)
rooms.description: Wheat and corn fields extend toward the horizon, farmhouses dotting the land.

rooms.name: Country Lane Toward Future Subdivision
rooms.description: A quiet lane that will one day connect to suburban development.

rooms.name: Wooded Lot (Future Twin Pines Site)
rooms.description: A small wooded area with two young pine trees and scattered boulders.

rooms.name: Main Street (South) (1955)
rooms.description: A quieter stretch of Main Street with a few small warehouses and storage sheds.

rooms.name: Warehouse Row (1955)
rooms.description: Small, utilitarian warehouses serving local businesses.

rooms.name: Downtown Back Alley (1955)
rooms.description: A narrow alley behind the shops, useful for deliveries and quick shortcuts.
